chat_messages.text: When I select kicad pcb comp, it shows attributes that are hidden. How to make them hide even when selected

To hide attributes of KiCad PCB components even when selected, you can adjust the visibility settings in KiCad's PCB editor. Here are the steps you can try:

1. Open the PCB editor in KiCad.

2. Go to the top menu and select "View" > "Show/Hide Layers and Items".

3. In the dialog that opens, look for the "Items" tab.

4. Find the option for "Attributes" or "Component Attributes" and uncheck it.

5. Click "OK" to apply the changes.

This should hide the attributes even when components are selected. If you need to view or edit attributes later, you can toggle this setting back on using the same method.

If this doesn't solve the issue, there might be specific settings for the particular components you're using. In that case, you may need to adjust properties in the component libraries or footprint editor.

Remember that hiding attributes can make it harder to identify components later, so use this feature judiciously. It's often helpful to keep at least some key attributes visible for easier PCB assembly and debugging.

chat_messages.text: kicad 8.0.2

Thank you for specifying the KiCad version. For KiCad 8.0.2, the process to hide attributes even when components are selected is slightly different from older versions. Here's how you can achieve this:

1. Open your PCB file in KiCad's PCB Editor.

2. Go to the top menu and select "View" > "Appearance Settings" (or press 'A' on your keyboard).

3. In the Appearance Settings dialog, switch to the "Board Items" tab.

4. Look for the "Footprints" section.

5. Find the option "Show footprint text" and uncheck it.

6. If you want to hide reference designators as well, uncheck "Show reference designators".

7. Click "OK" to apply the changes.

This should hide the attributes and text for all footprints, even when they're selected. If you need to see this information temporarily, you can toggle these settings back on using the same method.

Keep in mind that hiding all footprint text can make it challenging to identify components on your board. You might want to keep reference designators visible for easier assembly and debugging.

If you need to hide attributes for specific components only, you may need to edit the footprints themselves in the Footprint Editor. However, this is a more advanced operation and will affect all instances of that footprint in your projects.

I apologize for the confusion. You're right, and I made a mistake in my previous response. Let me provide the correct steps for KiCad 8.0.2:

1. Open your PCB file in KiCad's PCB Editor.

2. Go to the top menu and select "View" > "Layer and Items Visibility" (or press 'L' on your keyboard).

3. In the "Layer and Items Visibility" panel that opens (usually on the right side), look for the "Items" tab.

4. In the "Items" tab, find the "Footprints" section.

5. Uncheck the box next to "Footprint text" to hide all footprint text, including attributes.

6. If you want to hide only attributes but keep reference designators visible, you might need to adjust this in the footprint properties individually.

7. Close the panel or click anywhere on the PCB to apply the changes.

These settings should hide the footprint text even when components are selected. If you need to see this information again, you can toggle these settings back on using the same method.

If you're still having trouble or if this doesn't address your specific issue with attributes, please provide more details about which attributes are showing up when you don't want them to. There might be component-specific settings we need to address.

chat_messages.text: kicad hide a layer even when component selected

Ah, I see. You're looking to hide a specific layer even when a component is selected. In KiCad 8.0.2, you can achieve this by adjusting the layer visibility settings. Here's how to do it:

1. Open your PCB file in KiCad's PCB Editor.

2. Go to the top menu and select "View" > "Layer and Items Visibility" (or press 'L' on your keyboard).

3. In the "Layer and Items Visibility" panel that opens (usually on the right side), look for the "Layers" tab.

4. In the list of layers, find the specific layer you want to hide. Common layers that might contain attributes include:
   - "F.Fab" (Front Fabrication)
   - "B.Fab" (Back Fabrication)
   - "F.SilkS" (Front Silkscreen)
   - "B.SilkS" (Back Silkscreen)

5. Click the "eye" icon next to the layer name to toggle its visibility off. When the eye is crossed out, the layer is hidden.

6. Close the panel or click anywhere on the PCB to apply the changes.

This method will hide the selected layer globally, meaning it will remain hidden even when you select components. The layer will stay hidden until you manually make it visible again using the same process.

If you're specifically trying to hide attributes but keep other aspects of the layer visible, you might need to edit the footprints themselves in the Footprint Editor to move the attributes to a separate layer that you can then hide.

Remember that hiding layers can make it more difficult to identify components or see important information during design and assembly. Make sure to document any changes you make to standard visibility settings for future reference.

chat_messages.text:
Based on the image you've provided, I can see that you're working in KiCad's PCB editor and you're looking at a complex circuit board design. The components (likely resistors or capacitors) are visible and highlighted in pink boxes, which typically indicates they are selected.

To hide specific layers even when components are selected, you should:

1. Look at the right side of your screen where you can see the layer list.

2. Find the layer that contains the information you want to hide. Based on your previous question, you might be interested in hiding the "F.Fab" (Front Fabrication) or "F.SilkS" (Front Silkscreen) layers, which often contain component values and reference designators.

3. Click on the "eye" icon next to the layer name to toggle its visibility off. When the eye is crossed out, the layer will be hidden.

4. If you want to hide multiple layers, repeat this process for each layer.

This will hide the selected layers globally, even when components are selected. The layers will remain hidden until you manually make them visible again using the same process.

Remember that hiding layers can make it more difficult to identify components or see important information during design and assembly. Make sure you're aware of which layers you've hidden for future reference.

If you're still seeing information you want to hide after doing this, it might be worth checking if the information is on a different layer than you expect, or if it's part of the footprint definition itself.

chat_messages.text: the F.FAb and B.FAb are hidden but still showing the text when selected

I understand the issue now. You've already hidden the F.Fab and B.Fab layers, but you're still seeing text when components are selected. This is a known behavior in KiCad, where certain text elements become visible when a component is selected, regardless of layer visibility settings. Here's how you can address this:

1. Go to the top menu and select "Preferences" > "Preferences" (or press Ctrl+,).

2. In the Preferences window, navigate to "PCB Editor" > "Display".

3. Look for a section called "Footprint editing".

4. Find the option "Show footprint text when editing" and uncheck it.

5. Click "OK" to apply the changes.

This should prevent the text from appearing even when components are selected. 

If you're still seeing text after this, it might be coming from a different layer or it could be part of the component's core graphics. In that case:

1. Try hiding other layers like F.SilkS and B.SilkS.

2. If the text is part of the component's core graphics, you may need to edit the footprint itself in the Footprint Editor to remove or modify the text.

Remember that hiding this information can make it more difficult to identify components during design and assembly. Consider using this setting judiciously and documenting your changes for future reference.

If you're still having issues after trying these steps, you might want to check if there's a KiCad update available, as sometimes these behaviors are addressed in newer versions.

chat_messages.text:
"Preferences" -> "Preferences..."

"PCB Editor" (sub menu) "Display Option" 
unchecked "Show all fields when parent footprint is selected"

Thank you for providing that detailed explanation and screenshot! You've pinpointed the exact solution:

1. Go to "Preferences" -> "Preferences..."
2. Navigate to the "PCB Editor" submenu, then "Display Options"
3. Uncheck the option "Show all fields when parent footprint is selected"

This setting is indeed the key to preventing text and fields from appearing when a component is selected, even if the associated layers (like F.Fab and B.Fab) are hidden. 

Your clear explanation will be incredibly helpful for other KiCad users who might encounter the same issue. It's a great example of how sharing specific solutions can benefit the broader community of PCB designers and electronic engineers.

Thank you for taking the time to share this information. It's users like you who help make troubleshooting easier for everyone in the KiCad community.
